trans-unit.source: OAUTH Security in SaaS Connectors and API Apps | Azure
trans-unit.target: OAUTH Security in SaaS Connectors and API Apps | Azure

trans-unit.source: Read about OAUTH security in the Connectors and API Apps in Azure App Service; microservices architecture; saas
trans-unit.target: Read about OAUTH security in the Connectors and API Apps in Azure App Service; microservices architecture; saas

trans-unit.source: Learn about OAUTH Security in SaaS connectors
trans-unit.target: Learn about OAUTH Security in SaaS connectors

trans-unit.source: Many of the Software as a Service (SaaS) connectors like Facebook, Twitter, DropBox, and so on require users to authorize using the OAUTH protocol.
trans-unit.target: Many of the Software as a Service (SaaS) connectors like Facebook, Twitter, DropBox, and so on require users to authorize using the OAUTH protocol.

trans-unit.source: When you use these SaaS Connectors from Logic Apps, we provide a simplified user experience where you click "Authorize" in the Logic Apps designer.
trans-unit.target: When you use these SaaS Connectors from Logic Apps, we provide a simplified user experience where you click "Authorize" in the Logic Apps designer.

trans-unit.source: When you **Authorize**, you are asked to sign in (if not already) and provide consent to connect to the SaaS service on your behalf.
trans-unit.target: When you **Authorize**, you are asked to sign in (if not already) and provide consent to connect to the SaaS service on your behalf.

trans-unit.source: When you do provide consent and authorize, your Logic Apps can then access these SaaS services.
trans-unit.target: When you do provide consent and authorize, your Logic Apps can then access these SaaS services.

trans-unit.source: Create your own SaaS app
trans-unit.target: Create your own SaaS app

trans-unit.source: This simplified experience is possible because we previously created and registered our application in these SaaS services.
trans-unit.target: This simplified experience is possible because we previously created and registered our application in these SaaS services.

trans-unit.source: In certain cases, you may want to register and use your own application.
trans-unit.target: In certain cases, you may want to register and use your own application.

trans-unit.source: This is necessary, for instance, when you want to use these SaaS connectors in your custom applications, for example at [Deploy a SaaS connector API app](app-service-api-connnect-your-app-to-saas-connector.md).
trans-unit.target: This is necessary, for instance, when you want to use these SaaS connectors in your custom applications, for example at [Deploy a SaaS connector API app](app-service-api-connnect-your-app-to-saas-connector.md).

trans-unit.source: This example uses the DropBox Connector, but the process is the same for all connectors that rely on OAUTH.
trans-unit.target: This example uses the DropBox Connector, but the process is the same for all connectors that rely on OAUTH.

trans-unit.source: Even in the context of Logic Apps, you can use your own application instead of using the default application that we provide.
trans-unit.target: Even in the context of Logic Apps, you can use your own application instead of using the default application that we provide.

trans-unit.source: If the "Authorize" button fails to connect, you can try creating your own app.
trans-unit.target: If the "Authorize" button fails to connect, you can try creating your own app.

trans-unit.source: The following lists these steps for the Twitter connector:
trans-unit.target: The following lists these steps for the Twitter connector:

trans-unit.source: Open your Twitter Connector in the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: Open your Twitter Connector in the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: Go to **Browse** > **API Apps**.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Browse** > **API Apps**.

trans-unit.source: Select your Twitter connector:
trans-unit.target: Select your Twitter connector:

trans-unit.source: Select **Settings** > **Authentication**:
trans-unit.target: Select **Settings** > **Authentication**:

trans-unit.source: Copy the **Redirect URI** value:
trans-unit.target: Copy the **Redirect URI** value:

trans-unit.source: Go to [Twitter](http://apps.twitter.com) and **Create a New App**.
trans-unit.target: Go to [Twitter](http://apps.twitter.com) and **Create a New App**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Callback URL** property, paste the **Redirect URI** value copied from your Twitter connector:
trans-unit.target: In the **Callback URL** property, paste the **Redirect URI** value copied from your Twitter connector:

trans-unit.source: When your Twitter app is created, select **Key and Access Tokens**.
trans-unit.target: When your Twitter app is created, select **Key and Access Tokens**.

trans-unit.source: Copy these values.
trans-unit.target: Copy these values.

trans-unit.source: In your Twitter connector authentication settings, paste these values in the **Client ID** and **Client Secret** properties:
trans-unit.target: In your Twitter connector authentication settings, paste these values in the **Client ID** and **Client Secret** properties:

trans-unit.source: Save your connector settings.
trans-unit.target: Save your connector settings.

trans-unit.source: Now, you should be able to use your Connector from Logic Apps.
trans-unit.target: Now, you should be able to use your Connector from Logic Apps.

trans-unit.source: When you use this Connector from Logic Apps, it uses your application instead of the default application.
trans-unit.target: When you use this Connector from Logic Apps, it uses your application instead of the default application.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you have authorized an app previously, you may have to reauthorize the app.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you have authorized an app previously, you may have to reauthorize the app.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
